briefTitle: Ranibizumab Intravitreal Injections Versus Sham Control in Patients With Central Retinal Vein Occlusion (CRVO)
officialTitle: A Randomized Double-masked, Phase III Study Assessing Ranibizumab Intravitreal Injections Versus Sham Control in Patients With Visual Impairment Due to Macular Edema (ME) Secondary to Central Retinal Vein Occlusion (CRVO) [Camellia]
summary: Provide efficacy and safety data on intravitreal injections of ranibizumab 0.5 mg in patients with visual impairment due to macular edema secondary to CRVO

primaryOutcome.measure: Average Change in Visual Acuity (Letters) From Baseline to Month 1 Through Month 3
